title: Methodology for Designing and Developing Mobile Microlearning-Based Courseware

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: A course for working professionals aiming to enhance competency in developing social studies education content in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: By utilizing the four models of the Integrated Modeling Approach (CEM)—pedagogical, conceptual, interface, and hypermedia—courseware suitable for mobile environments can be designed.
Educational content that maximizes learning effectiveness can be developed by combining software engineering principles with multimedia elements.
A learner-centered interface design and navigation structure can be implemented to provide effective learning experiences even in smartphone environments.

resources: Simple authoring tools (Canva, Google Docs, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
